official-title.#text:
To provide for nuclear weapons abolition and economic
		  conversion in accordance with District of Columbia Initiative Measure Number 37
		  of 1992, while ensuring environmental restoration and clean-energy
		  conversion.

sponsor.#tail:
introduced
			 the following bill; which was referred to the

committee-name.#tail: , and in addition to the Committee on

, for a
			 period to be subsequently determined by the Speaker, in each case for
			 consideration of such provisions as fall within the jurisdiction of the
			 committee concerned

short-title.#text:
Nuclear Weapons Abolition and Economic
			 and Energy Conversion Act of 2013

text.#text: This Act may be cited as the

header.#text:
Requirement for
			 nuclear weapons abolition and economic and energy conversion

text.#text:
provide leadership to negotiate and enter
			 into a multilateral treaty or other international agreement by the date that is
			 three years after the date of the enactment of this Act that provides
			 for—

strict and
			 effective international control of such dismantlement and elimination;

redirect resources
			 that are being used for nuclear weapons programs to use—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Nuclear Weapons Abolition and Economic and Energy Conversion Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a/p:1

text.#text:
in converting all
			 nuclear weapons industry employees, processes, plants, and programs smoothly to
			 constructive, ecologically beneficial peacetime activities, including strict
			 control of all fissile material and radioactive waste, during the period in
			 which nuclear weapons must be dismantled and eliminated pursuant to the treaty
			 or other international agreement described in

in addressing
			 human and infrastructure needs, including development and deployment of
			 sustainable carbon-free and nuclear-free energy sources, health care, housing,
			 education, agriculture, and environmental restoration, including long-term
			 radioactive waste monitoring;

undertake
			 vigorous, good-faith efforts to eliminate war, armed conflict, and all military
			 operations; and

actively promote
			 policies to induce all other countries to join in the commitments described in
			 this subsection to create a more peaceful and secure world.

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail: shall take effect on the date on which the
{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Nuclear Weapons Abolition and Economic and Energy Conversion Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a/p:2

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.#tail:
that all countries possessing nuclear weapons
			 have—

{http://namespaces.cato.org/catoxml}enti.@value: Nuclear Weapons Abolition and Economic and Energy Conversion Act of 2013/s:2/ss:a

text.#text:
begun such
			 elimination under established legal requirements comparable to those described
			 in

{http://purl.org/dc/elements/1.1/}title.#text: 113 HR 1650 IH: Nuclear Weapons Abolition and Economic and Energy Conversion Act of 2013
